customOptions.name: Tooltip Values
customOptions.label: Configure Tooltip Values
customOptions.hint: Customize which values are shown in the Tooltip. Custom Tooltip Values allow you to show tooltips for any numerical data associated with a token's actor.
customOptions.title: Tooltip Values Configuration

instructions.top: For each Standard Tooltip Value, select the permission required to see those values (note: not all standard values show for all systems). For each Custom Tooltip Value, specify a Name, Icon, and Data Key.
instructions.name: A name for the data shown. If no icon is specified, the name will be displayed instead of an icon in the tooltip.
instructions.icon: The name of the Font Awesome icon to show in the tooltip. A preview of the icon is shown to the right of the input to help ensure you select the right icon. If left blank, the name will be shown instead of an icon. Note that not all Font Awesome icons are available (FoundryVTT itself is in control over which icons are available, not this module - this module is just using the icons that are shipped with FoundryVTT).
instructions.iconLink: Search for icons on the Font Awesome Website
instructions.attributeKey:
The property key used to lookup the value you want to show in the tooltip. For example, to show the CR of a creature using the DnD5e system, specify `system.details.cr`. The Data Key Debugger can be enabled to assist in finding the correct Data Key for the information you want to display.
You can use +, -, * (multiply), / (divide), and % (modulo) to perform basic math (operations are applied left-to-right, NOT PEMDAS; e.g. `5+5*2` would be 20, not 15). You can also use <, >, <=, >=, != (not equal), or == (equal) to suppress a line if the specified condition is not met (e.g. `system.skills.perception.value != 0 + 10` will show a value 10 greater than the token's perception skill, but only if the token's perception skill is not zero). You can also use & to concatenate multiple values together, and "quotes" to specify fixed strings (e.g. `system.carryWeight.value & " lbs"` would show as `72 lbs`)
instructions.permission: The minimum permission a player must have to see this value in an actor's tooltip (assuming they can see the tooltip at all - see the Tooltip Visibility setting on the main settings page). Note: GMs are considered Owners for all actors.
instructions.gmPermission: This setting allows players to see their own details in the tooltip while hiding that information from GMs. Note: This checks if the token has a Player Owner, and not the character type, so an NPC character with a player owner counts as player info, and a PC character without a player owner counts as NPC info.
instructions.showOnPersistent: This setting allows details to show on the hover tooltips, but be hidden on the persistent tooltips. Note: The other permission settings must pass in addition to this setting being enabled for details to show on the persistent tooltips - data cannot be shown in the persistent tooltip but hidden in the hover tooltip.
instructions.bugs: Click here to report bugs or request features

importExport.name: Import / Export Tooltip Values
importExport.label: Import / Export
importExport.hint: Export Tooltip Values from one world and Import them to another (or share them with Illandril to help with debugging issues).
importExport.title: Illandril's Token Tooltips Import / Export

instructions.bugs: Click here to report bugs or request features
instructions.notes: This utility only imports or exports the Tooltip Values settings. Other tooltip settings (e.g. Persistent Tooltips, Simplify HP for Players, etc) are not included. Clicking Export will prompt you to download a `.json` file. Clicking Import will prompt you to select a previously downloaded `.json` file. Import may fail if you attempt to import settings exported from a different version of Illandril's Token Tooltips.

importExport.confirmImport: Are you sure you want to overwrite your current Tooltip Values settings? WARNING: There is no "undo" - if you import to the wrong place, and don't have a valid saved export to restore from, you will need to manually restore your previous settings one by one from memory.
importExport.error: The selected file could not be read. Make sure you are using an export from a world that was using the same version of Illandril's Token Tooltips.
importExport.success: Tooltip Values have been imported. Consider clicking Configure Tooltip Values to confirm you imported the expected settings.

persistentTooltips.name: Persistent Tooltips
persistentTooltips.label: Configure Persistent Tooltips
persistentTooltips.hint: Configure Tooltips to always show in certain areas of the screen. Note: Unlike most other settings for this module, this is configurable per client instead of applying to everyone, allowing you to have persistent tooltips on a Tabletop Monitor for players to always see without cluttering up your GM screen.
persistentTooltips.title: Persistent Tooltip Configuration

instructions.bugs: Click here to report bugs or request features
instructions.top: Persistent Tooltips are visible whenever the associated Actor is visible on the current scene. If multiple tooltips are configured in the same location, they will be placed side-by-side. If a configured tooltip is not showing, verify that the ID is correct (check for extra whitespace before or after the ID), and make sure you have permission to see the tooltip by hovering over the token.
instructions.type: Actor looks up the token for the tooltip based on the Actor ID. User looks up the token for the tooltip based on the specified user's selected character (selected as their character via User Configuration, not token selection).
instructions.id:
To get the ID for an Actor, open the actor's Actor Sheet and click on the book icon in the dialog title to copy the actor's ID.
To get the ID for a User, right-click on the user in the Players list and open the User Configuration dialog, then click the book icon in the dialog title to copy the user's ID.
instructions.id_bad: Indicates that the specified ID was invalid - double check the type and ID values.
instructions.id_good: Indicates that the specified ID was valid, but there is no associated token on the current scene. Hover over the icon to see the name of the associated User or Actor.
instructions.id_best: Indicates that the specified ID was valid, and there is an associated token on the current scene. Hover over the icon to see the name of the associated Token.
instructions.rotation: The rotation of the tooltip, in degrees (clockwise).

visibility.label: Tooltip Visibility
visibility.hint: Tooltip Visibility adjusts which tokens show tooltips for players. Tooltips are shown for all tokens for GMs.

choice.NEUTRAL: Neutral and Friendly Tokens (PC and NPC)
choice.NONE: No Tokens (Show tooltips to GMs only)

simplifyHP.label: Simplify HP for Players
simplifyHP.hint: Simplify the HP value shown to players (if HP is shown - Configure Tooltip Values above to configure when HP is visible at all). The unsimplified value is always shown to GMs.

simplifyDamageTypes.label: Res. / Imm. / Vuln. Style
simplifyDamageTypes.hint: Specify how damage and condition type values for resistances, immunities, and vulnerabilities are shown. Not all types have icons - if a type does not have an icon, the name will be shown even if Icon is selected.

disableTooltips.label: Disable Tooltips
disableTooltips.hint: If checked, Tooltips will not show for you regardless of what other settings are configured by the GM for this module (client setting - does not impact other players). Note: Applies only to dynamic tooltips, and does not impact Persistent Tooltips, which you already can separately add or delete at will in the Configure Persistent Tooltips menu.

setting.rowsPerTooltip.label: Tooltip Rows (Hover)
setting.rowsPerTooltip.hint: The maximum number of rows shown in each column in the Tooltip.
setting.tooltipFontSize.label: Tooltip Font Size (Hover)
setting.tooltipFontSize.hint: The ratio of the font size of the Tooltips that show on hover, relative to the font size used in most other places in the application.
setting.rowsPerPersistent.label: Persistent Tooltip Rows
setting.rowsPerPersistent.hint: The maximum number of rows shown in each column in Persistent Tooltips.
setting.persistentFontSize.label: Persistent Tooltip Font Size
setting.persistentFontSize.hint: The ratio of the font size of Persistent Tooltips, relative to the font size used in most other places in the application.
setting.darkMode.label: Dark Mode
setting.darkMode.hint: If checked, the tooltip will show in a dark color scheme (as opposed to light).
setting.showOnLeft.label: Show on Left
setting.showOnLeft.hint: If checked, the tooltip will show on the left side of tokens (as opposed to the right side).
setting.showTokenName.label: Show Token Name
setting.showTokenName.hint: If checked, the tooltip will show on the Token's name at the top of the tooltip.
setting.showOnHighlightHotkey.label: Show on Highlight Hotkey
setting.showOnHighlightHotkey.hint: If checked, the tooltip will show (for the currently selected Token only) when you press the Highlight Objects hotkey (ALT by default; configurable in Configure Controls). Note: Not compatible with Show only with Tooltip Hotkey.
setting.showOnlyWithTooltipHotkey.label: Show only with Tooltip Hotkey
setting.showOnlyWithTooltipHotkey.hint: If checked, the tooltip will show only when the Show Tooltip Hotkey is pressed while hovering over a token (SHIFT by default; configurable in Configure Controls). Note: Not compatible with Show on Highlight Hotkey.
